data.title: Warriors missing a good chunk of their bench vs OKC
data.meta_description: Golden State Warriors, Oklahoma City Thunder, Andre Iguodala, Kevon Looney, Omri Casspi
data.text:
(Click here, if you are unable to view this photo gallery on your mobile device.)

Want Warriors news in your inbox? Sign up for the free DubsDaily newsletter.

OKLAHOMA CITY — The Warriors might have three All-Stars back, but they have lost a good chunk of their bench.

The Warriors (56-21) enter Tuesday’s game against the Oklahoma City Thunder (45-33) with Andre Iguodala (left knee), Kevon Looney (flu), Omri Casspi (right ankle) and Shaun Livingston (personal reasons) all ruled out. Oh, and Warriors guards Stephen Curry (left MCL sprain) and Patrick McCaw (lumbar spine contusion) are sidelined, too.

As if Warriors coach Steve Kerr did not already have enough concerns with the Thunder’s Russell Westbrook, Paul George, Steven Adams and Carmelo Anthony on his mind.

Kerr expressed optimism that Iguodala will return for Thursday’s game in Indiana after missing the previous two games with the same injury. It is not clear on the other reserves, though. Looney and Livingston are not currently with the team, though it is possible either could rejoin the Warriors in Indiana.

For now, Kerr will start Zaza Pachulia at center to counter Adams’ size. The Warriors will also have their three All-Stars in Kevin Durant, Draymond Green and Klay Thompson start alongside Quinn Cook.
